title: Remove BO and Move Arugula Microgreens to Watering Rack
description: Move to watering rack

title: Seed Broccoli Microgreens
description: Seed Broccoli Microgreens

title: Soak Pea Microgreens
description: Soak the Seeds for 12 hours; Drain and rinse occasionaly until tomorrow afternoon.

title: Remove Weight/BO and Move Radish Microgreens to Watering Rack
description: Remove Weight/BO and Move Radish Microgreens

title: Adjust Nutrients in Microgreen Reservoirs
description: Check the nutrient and pH level and adjust

title: Clean Bathroom
description: Clean the Bathroom

title: Deep Floor Scrub
description: This task is designed to deep clean stained and heavily soiled areas of the facility floor using a baking soda solution and manual scrubbing. It is part of maintaining a professional, clean, and safe work environment.

title: Opening
description: Open the farm.

title: Clean Tower Clips
description: Clean tower clips.

title: Check the Inventory of Leafy Green Stock
description: Check the Rockwool, Oasis Cubes, Seeds, and Leafy Green Bags.

title: Check General Inventory Stock
description: Check the stock of Order Bags, Order Boxes, Labels, and More

title: Check Nutrient Inventory
description: Ensure we have enough nutrients to last roughlt three months.

title: Uncover the Leafy Green and Herb trays.
description: There should be many trays to uncover including Romaine, Swiss Chard, Butter Crunch, Red Oak, Kale, Summer Crisp, Basil, and Collard Greens

title: Seed Pea Microgreens
description: Use soaked seeds. Place trays directly into Watering Rack. Use 1 shim under tray in watering rack.

title: Seed Radish Microgreens
description: Seed the Radish Microgreens

title: Seed Mustard Microgreens
description: Do not stack while germinating.

title: Remove Weight/BO and Move Broccoli Microgreens to Watering Rack
description: Put in D watering rack on shelf with fan; After move, run water in rack until tray is wet.

title: Remove Weight and BO for Pea Microgreens
description: Remove Weight and dome for Pea Microgreens

title: Remove BO and Move Mustard Microgreens to Watering Rack
description: Remove Dome and Move Mustard Microgreens to Watering Rack

title: Harvest Pea Microgreens
description: Apis: 3 oz in 24 oz container; Others: 1 oz in 8 oz container

title: Harvest Broccoli Microgreens
description: 1 oz per 8 oz container

title: Harvest Radish Microgreens
description: 1 oz in 8 oz container

title: Harvest Mustard Microgreens
description: 0.7 oz in 8 oz container

title: Seed Arugula Microgreens
description: Mucilagenous seeds; do not stack

title: Harvest Arugula Micogreens
description: 0.5 oz in 8 oz container

title: Change Microgreen Reservoir Water and Clean Shelves
description: This process ensures that the water in the microgreen reservoir is fresh and properly prepared with nutrients and pH adjustments to maintain optimal plant growth. Regular water changes prevent buildup of debris, pathogens, and nutrient imbalances.

title: Check Paper Towel Levels
description: This process ensures that the farm is secured, cleaned, and organized at the end of the day. Proper closing procedures help maintain a safe, efficient workspace and prepare the facility for the next day.

title: Remove Garbage from Non-Farm areas
description: This process outlines the steps for collecting and disposing of trash from various locations outside of the main farm area, including the lobby and office. Proper trash disposal maintains cleanliness, prevents odors, and ensures a professional environment.

title: Vacuum the Office and Lobby
description: This process ensures that the office and lobby areas are vacuumed thoroughly to maintain cleanliness and a professional appearance. Regular vacuuming removes dirt, debris, and allergens, creating a clean environment for employees and visitors.

title: Clean Outside Facing Lobby Window
description: This process ensures the lobby’s outside-facing windows are cleaned to maintain a professional and welcoming appearance. Regular cleaning removes smudges, dirt, and streaks, leaving the glass spotless and clear.

title: Washing Farm Towels and Filter Socks
description: This process outlines the steps for staff to take farm towels and filter socks home for washing, ensuring they are cleaned and returned in a timely and hygienic manner. Regular washing helps maintain cleanliness and prevent cross-contamination.

title: Clean Farm Floor
description: This process ensures the farm’s floors are cleaned thoroughly and sanitized using a power mop.

title: Interior Window Cleaning
description: This process outlines the steps required to open the vertical farm safely and efficiently. The checklist ensures that all systems are operational, environmental conditions are optimal, and any issues are promptly reported.

title: Check pH and Water Levels in Towers
description: This process ensures the water pH and levels in all towers are within the optimal range for plant health. Adjustments are made as needed to maintain a target pH of 6.0 and adequate water levels using ATOs (Automatic Top Offs).

title: Seed Leafy Greens
description: Seed the leafy greens needed based off of the leafy green seedling planning spreadsheet.

title: Harvest Turnip Microgreens
description: 1 oz per 8 oz container

title: Harvest Spicy Mix Microgreens
description: 0.7 oz per 8 oz container

title: Remove Weight/BO and Move Turnip Microgreens to Watering Rack
description: Remove Weight/BO and Move Turnip Microgreens to Watering Rack

title: Remove BO and Move Spicy Mix Microgreens to Watering Rack
description: Remove BO and Move Spicy Mix Microgreens to Watering Rack

title: Seed Turnip Microgreens
description: Seed Turnip Microgreens

title: Seed Spicy Mix Microgreens
description: Seed Spicy Mix Microgreens

title: Clean Tower Basins
description: This task ensures proper disassembly, cleanup, and preparation of Tower Garden basins. By vacuuming out debris and, when necessary, fully emptying the basin, we ensure that the system remains clean and supports healthy plant growth.

title: Set Clean Towers
description: This task ensures a freshly cleaned basin receives a clean, fully assembled tower. Proper setup guarantees water is circulating correctly and the tower is ready for new planting.

title: Clean Tower Garden Pots
description: This task ensures Tower Garden pots and structural rods are thoroughly cleaned and prepped after soaking. Removing built-up grime supports plant health and extends the life of the towers.

title: Assemble Tower Gardens
description: This task covers the full assembly of Tower Garden units, from securing the base to testing water flow. Proper alignment and tightening are crucial for healthy plant growth and reliable irrigation.

title: Disassemble Towers
description: This task involves disassembling tower units in the back room after they have been removed from their growing position. By doing this later, staff can prioritize other time-sensitive tasks while still maintaining the cleanliness and readiness of the tower system.

title: Replace Fan and Furnace Filter
description: Replace the filter for the furnace and the fans to make sure that we don't get Mildew

title: Plant Towers
description: Plant the needed towers for the week based on the checklist.

title: Harvest Towers
description: Harvest the Towers in the checklist.
